attributes.action: Ofsted inspectors should he held to higher levels of accountability and scrutiny when interviewing children on sensitive matters
attributes.additional_details:
IF YOU ARE A PARENT / GRANDPARENT / CARER PLEASE READ

I am a parent of three children at Grindon Hall Christian School which was recently given an inadequate inspection rating and faces an uncertain future.

I am appaled that inspectors can interview children as young as 10 regarding matters of sexuality, religion and bullying in an intimidating group environment.  Some of the children now believe that they gave the "WRONG ANSWERS" and blame themeselves for the schools current situation.

This is not about faith schools or free schools, this is about our children and their future.  Something has gone seriously wrong with this inspection process and needs to be addressed before it damages our children any further
